title: What is ancient, medieval, and modern history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Before: stone Bronze age and Iron age. Celts, Slavs and germans live in Europe. Technologically divided by metallurgy archievments. Ancient: an era of ancient Greek and Rome. It lasts from ~1 000 b.c. to 476 a.c. Major impeium is Roman empire, well-organized realm in medditerian Europe. Rise of culture and science. Early middle ages: 476 - ~1 000. After centuries of Fall of Roman empire, year 476 is considered as it's final end. The lack of rule leads to invention of feudal system, where the power is held by nobility who rent it to lesser lords and commoners. Rise of first castles, fortified stronghold where the nobles live. Majority of common folk is still Pagan. Middle ages: ~1 000 - ~ 1 440. Feudal system is fully developed and majority of nobles follow Christianity, while most of the smallfolk still are Pagan but also many of them convert to Church. Era of large stone castle construction, founding of monasteries where knowledge risen. Majority of european towns dates their origin in these years. Invention of printing Press by Johann Gutenberg ends this era when knowledge (= books) is avaible to common folk. Late middle ages: ~1 440 - 1492. Era when people start to live in towns, leading to urbanization of society. First plague epidemies start in towns. Until now, people followed common hygiene eand livet at countryside (so NO, middle ages were not ‘dirty dark ages’ as common myths say). Modern ages: 1492 - 1918 Renneisance revolts lead to rise of art and culture. But also massive plague epidemies. After that, baroque comes with strong Christian thinking. People are drastically forced to convert to that faith. Mobility gets astronomically rich and ‘enslaves’ commoners, which leads to revolts (Great French revolutin). This years ends with WWI and Fall of Austria-hungary.
